topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: ALS Command Reference: Miscellaneous

ul.li: helion admin: A set of administrative tasks.
helion alias: Create a shortcut for a command.
helion aliases: List the known aliases (shortcuts).
helion color: Management of terminal colors.
helion curl: Run a raw REST request against the chosen target.
helion drain: Commands for the management of drains attached to applications.
helion guid: Map the specified name into a GUID given the type.
helion help: Retrieve help for a command or command set.
helion named-entities: List the entity types usable for GUID.
helion trace: Print the saved REST trace for the last client command to stdout.
helion unalias: Remove a shortcut by name.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: For more information, use the helion help or helion help [command] commands.

section.title: helion alias <name> <command>
section.p: Create a shortcut (alias) for a command.

row.entry: Print raw json as output, not human-formatted data.

section.title: helion curl <operation> <path> <header>
section.p: Run a raw REST request against the chosen target.

row.entry: Payload to use for PUT and POST. Cannot be used with neither GET nor DELETE. A value of "-" or "stdin" causes the client to read the data from stdin.
Zero or more form fields to be added to the base url. Data is in the form of "key: value".
Path to the file to write the returned payload to. A value of "-" or "stdin" causes the client to write the data to stdout.
The port to use for the request. Only relevant to websocket operation.
Automatically reconnect when the websocket server closes the connection. Only relevant to websocket operation.
Show additional information about the request; for example, response headers.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
Switch to WebSocket mode for GET. Cannot be used with any other operation.

section.title: helion drain {command-drain}
section.p: Commands for the management of drains attached to applications.

section.title: helion guid <type> <name>
section.p: Map the specified name into a uuid, given the type.

section.title: helion help <CommandName>
section.p: Retrieve help for a command or command set. Without an argument, help for all commands is given. The default format is --full.

row.entry: Activate full form of the help.
Activate json form of the help.
Activate list form of the help.
Activate short form of the help.
The line width to format the help for. Defaults to the terminal width, or 80 when no terminal is available.

section.title: helion named-entities
section.p: List the entity types usable for 'guid'. I.e. the types of the named entities known to the client.

section.title: helion trace
section.p: Print the saved REST trace for the last client command to stdout.

row.entry: Shows only the short list of requests without details like headers and responses.
